explanation: Not correct. The match function OS_FileSys_FindVirtMountPoint filters for records with the virtual-mounted bit set, but it does not check or clear the system-mounted bit. Nothing in the shown code guarantees that the system-mounted flag cannot also be set (i.e. the flags byte could have both bits). Therefore it is possible at runtime for a record to pass the search and also have OS_FILESYS_FLAG_IS_MOUNTED_SYSTEM set, making the strncpy branch reachable. MISRA Rule 2.1 requires that code be proven unreachable in all possible executions; that proof is not present here. (Even if project design intends the two mount states to be mutually exclusive, that intent is not enforced in the shown code, so the branch cannot be classified as unreachable.)
